PolicyPage.Name: Buying a House as a Single Student
PolicyPage.Title: Can I buy a house to live in as a single student?
PolicyPage.Abstract: Students are required to live in Approved Housing. Houses are no longer being approved for single students to live in.
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Full-time BYU-Idaho single students should plan to live in approved housing as long as they are a single student attending BYU-Idaho. Any exception to this policy should be cleared with the Housing & Student Living Office first (More about exceptions here).

We will occassionally get questions about parents purchasing a house for their children to live in while attending BYU-Idaho. In cooperation with the city of Rexburg, houses will no longer be approved for single students (See the converted house policy). As a guideline new Approved Housing units are asked to house at least 20 students and have an on-site manager (those interested in developing Approved Housing should contact Jon Phister, Owner & Developer Relations Manager).
